poem:
Survive to 2025

Across the ink of morning news,
small screens stagnant as ponds,
driftwood companies 
cling to the shore,
numbers like pebbles 
slipping through fingers,
each one a blurred face
in the halls of network moguls,
production lines unspooled
like old film reels,
hoping for scenes
no editor would cut.
